intro: Carpesium acutum, commonly known as the thistleweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and can be found in prairies and open woodlands. Its leaves are spiny and hairy, while the flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer. Carpesium acutum is often used in herbal medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
